content:
I've been experimenting with wet-on-wet and glazing techniques to achieve the soft, dreamy light in my watercolor pieces. I've also been using a lot of transparent washes and layering them to build up the colors. It's been a process of trial and error, but I'm slowly getting the hang of it.

As for visiting Giverny, I actually just got back from a trip to Paris, and I didn't get a chance to visit Giverny while I was there. But it's definitely on my bucket list for next time. I did, however, pick up some art-related souvenirs, including a set of art postcards and a beautiful handmade journal with a watercolor cover. It's been inspiring me to keep working on my watercolor skills.

Speaking of which, I've been meaning to get my grandmother's old oil painting restored. It's been in storage for years, but I finally got around to taking it to the local
